quest.name: While You Were Away
journal: Home is where the heart is, and Alphinaud's is in Eorzea.
objectives: Speak with Thancred at Castrum Oriens.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We've been away for far too long, but finally─finally, we're going to make things right!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It feels like a lifetime ago that we left for Kugane, doesn't it?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We should inform the Admiral of our arrival, and brief her on that which took place in Doma before leaving the city.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Here we are, home at last. I must say, the journey passed more quickly than I had expected.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That would be due to the absence of otherworldly interference, I expect.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I-I should be glad if we did not speak of that unpleasantness again!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ahem. But in spite of all that and more, we return better for the experience─and, more importantly, triumphant.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Indeed. And with Doma freed of imperial oppression, it is only right that we turn our thoughts to the plight of Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, I'm all for that, obviously, but I think you should go and see the refugees at Revenant's Toll before doing anything else. They'll be thrilled to hear what we've accomplished, and it'd sound best coming from you.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: ...Thank you. I shall do as you suggest.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I see I am not too late.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Admiral! What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The East Aldenard Trading Company informed me of your impending arrival. I have tidings I thought best to share with you in person.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: From Gyr Abania?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye. The Alliance still holds the Wall, despite several imperial counterattacks. But we have been unable to press further into occupied territory.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Commander Kemp and his men, meanwhile, have made great strides toward rebuilding their depleted ranks. They have even taken it upon themselves to attempt some few operations...with mixed results, I am sorry to say. 'Twas a complication arising from one such venture which moved me to seek you out.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: During a mission to transport wounded Resistance fighters to the Rising Stones, Krile Baldesion was taken prisoner.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Krile!? Do they know where she is being held?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: They do not. But your comrades were informed at once, and I am told Thancred is in Gyr Abania looking for her as we speak.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: How could this have happened...? We must seek out Thancred without delay!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Nay. Krile taught me better than that. It would be unwise to act without first acquiring a full understanding of the situation...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you for informing us. Tired though we may be, we must make haste to Castrum Oriens. Pray excuse us, Admiral, Lady Yugiri.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned! You should speak with Thancred. He is waiting for you with Arenvald.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Glad to have you with us again. Hmm...you seem stronger than I remember─hard though I find that to believe. One would almost think you'd spent the whole time fighting. Well done, by the way.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: I swear to you, the imperials will not cross this wall again, on my honor as a man of the Twin Adder.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: Imperial scum! We will make them pay for this!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Forename. It's all my fault...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: It's good to see you again...though I wish it were under better circumstances...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: There you are! You have heard the news?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In broad strokes from Admiral Bloefhiswyn. What happened?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Krile and a squadron of Resistance fighters were escorting Y'shtola and several other wounded to the Rising Stones for further treatment when they were ambushed by imperial forces.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Arenvald and his men fought valiantly, but in the chaos─

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I will make no excuses! We failed to protect her.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do not be so hard on yourself. You protected Y'shtola and the others, did you not? Tell us about the attack.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: It was the Skulls. They knew a path across the Wall we hadn't found. We thought we were safe once we reached the Black Shroud. <sigh> We weren't expecting an ambush...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: During the fighting, I caught a glimpse of their leader's memories. It was all planned.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The advantage of having a Walker in the field.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I'm not as strong in the Echo as Forename is, of course. Half the time, it's enough to knock me on my arse, like I've taken a dose of concentrated aether...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So you walked in Fordola's memories. What did you see?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: A woman promised the world─education, training, citizenship─all that and more if she but sold her soul. A traitor to her people, a pretender to her masters...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: ...It was Zenos himself that gave the order. Told her to return with Krile Baldesion─alive.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Our agents have been carefully monitoring imperial communications since the attack, but have yet to intercept any transmissions making reference to Krile or her current whereabouts.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If their orders were to bring Krile back alive, we can save her if we move quickly enough.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As you say, time is of the essence, which is why I intend to slip past enemy lines and see what information I can uncover on my own.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In the meantime, it is up to you and our allies to command the imperials' undivided attention. Lots of shouting and explosions and so forth. Keep them distracted, and I will find her.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Very well. I wish I could do more to aid you, but I understand.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Commander Kemp is on his way to the castrum as we speak for a meeting with General Aldynn. If you hurry, you could find him on the road, and discuss the situation beforehand.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I think Forename and I are going to go and see Conrad like he suggested. You all wait here.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What can I say? Patience isn't one of my virtues.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...I wish I could go with him. It would be utterly self-defeating, but I would do it nevertheless.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There's nothing wrong with wanting something stupid, so long as you don't act on it. Remember that there are other ways you can help her.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Alphinaud called it an advantage, but in truth, it was a liability. The vision left me reeling, and Fordola seized the opening to push past and snatch up Krile. I'm sorry...

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Once Commander Kemp and his men arrive, we can begin.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Well, well! Isn't this a pleasant surprise! It fills my heart with joy to see you two hale and healthy.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Welcome home, Lyse, Forename. I'm sure you've heard about Krile by now...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: That's why we're here. I'm still not sure what to think about it...but we'll save her. We'll definitely save her somehow.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Aye, I've no doubt that you will. You look stronger for your time in the Far East, lass, and that's good news for Krile.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text:
I'd like to think so...
But enough about me─how is everything with you and the Resistance?

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Better than when you last saw us, and no mistake. Arenvald's been a godssend. Him and M'naago and all the other youngbloods have achieved so much in such a short time.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: We've been blessed to receive the support of the Flames' Ala Mhigan Brigade, who've been instrumental in freeing our countrymen from labor camps throughout Gyr Abania, as well as some political prisoners from the city proper, believe it or not.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Together with the refugees returning from Ul'dah and elsewhere, we've had no shortage of able-bodied men and women eager to join the cause.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I knew you wouldn't stop fighting, even after what happened at the Reach.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Force of habit, I suppose. Though we've come a long way, we still have far to go. But we'll fight for every ilm, and sooner or later, we'll get to Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: But listen to me prattling on when we should be making haste to Castrum Oriens. There's no point you telling me everything now when you'll only have to say it all again for the Flame General's benefit.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You're right. I'll go on ahead and tell the others that you're not far off.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: You can go ahead and tell Marshal Tarupin that Conrad's party will be arriving any moment.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I know, I know. There's naught to be gained from giving in to my emotions. I need to stay calm and composed. Krile herself would say as much.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ephemie and the others at the Rising Stones are looking after Y'shtola now. We need not fear for her safety.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: As for Krile, everything that can be done is being done. It falls to the rest of us to carry on the fight.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Y'shtola is safe, but it's still anyone's guess when she'll be strong enough to take to the field...

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Go on ahead, Forename. We'll not be far behind.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Losing Krile hit us hard. So many of us owe her our lives...which is why we owe it to her not to give up hope. We'll find her, I'm sure of it!

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: You have spoken with Thancred, then? Good. Take heart─if anyone can track her down, it's him.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: I believe I hear Commander Kemp's party approaching. If you are ready to address Father and the others, let us be about it.
